ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 10: Very valuable course. It kept me on track with my thesis and presentation skills.
The class is great for making students actually work on their research!
This is an amazing course. I could not finish my master's thesis without the guidance Mark Ashton and Elaine Hooper.

Mark and Elaine went way above and beyond the call of duty in the work they put into the class. Not wanting to turn research students away, Mark created two sections rather than one to accommodate the need for this type of seminar.
Ashton is great, a bit verbose at time and the classes dragged on for hours and hours, but overall everyone learned a lot
Keeping on track with my thesis and preparing for oral presentations

The opportunity to play my research ideas and results off my peers and Dr. Ashton. It really gave me a chance to explore my research and to learn from watching others explore theirs. I greatly gained from Dr. Ashton's time and experience. I actually hated having to give the same/revised presentations about my research over and over again throughout the year but in the end I realize that this made me much more comfortable about the story of my research. Please make this style of class available to all students who want it!
Professor Ashton's feedback on written and oral material. It helped refine my work.

Dr. Ashton provides invaluable support to students working on their master's project. I could not have done it without him or without this course. This course offers a community of peers that is working through the same struggles. And through this course I discovered how much I enjoy editing and giving constructive feedback! AND I became way way way more comfortable presenting. I'm so glad I took this course. Thank you Dr. Ashton!!!!
Deadlines and feedback on our work and performance.
The professor and TA!
Having to present your work incremenentally, and seeing other students present. I am a much more confident speaker now, and much more confident in my research.
The amount of feedback was phenomenal.
Mark Ashton! and the group comments and discussions.
The focus on research and maintaining a goal of publishing and superb guidance were exactly what I needed in order to finish my research (and well) for my masters degree.
It really helped me develop my thesis, it was crucial in keeping me on track (schedule-wise), and all the practice in presenting was very very helpful when it came time to present at the Colloquium.
This class helped keep me on pace with my thesis. In addition, I got to learn from my classmates - seeing where their project needed help (that mine did too) and getting ideas from them.
The peers and the good feedback

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: None
Less students. And students with interests similar to the professor. There were too many presentations to sit through in each class setting.

FES NEEDS ANOTHER FACULTY MEMBER TO STEP UP AND OFFER THEIR TIME AND EXPERTISE IN THE SOCIAL SCIENCES!! IT'S EMBARRASSING THAT NO FACULTY MEMBER DOES SO. DR ASHTON IS FILLING A BIG GAP IN THE CURRICULUM ALL ON HIS OWN - So, the thing about this course in need of improvement is to split it into a natural sciences and social sciences section - at the LEAST.
I only feel bad that Mark was taking on such a large load -- I STRONGLY suggest that other professors step up to make more courses like this available.
The only problem with the course was the size. A social science professor should teach the second section so that the group can be smaller and with more similar research interests/topics.
Smaller groups.
The class size was too large because more people had gotten word of it.

It was too large of a class. It should have been limited in number. Also, although it was helpful to get the practice in presenting my work, hearing my colleague's presentations again and again became tedious. If we had fewer students we could have supplemented the presentations with other exercises.
It would have been good to have some readings or outside materials on writing and presenting, though honestly I don't know that I would have had time to read them.
Mark needs to do better at keeping time!

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: I contacted both parities, and they were both great.
Both were very supportive and I praise their ability to hold two class sections per week.
Great.
The instructor provided way more feedback than I expected -- certainly more than my adviser.Elaine is an amazing TA and spent a ton of time helping us with stats. I'm really grateful for that.
Excellent- Elaine
Amazing! I have no idea how they did it for so many students.
Both Mark and Elaine gave tons of feedback and time in helping with the project. They were both wonderful.
excellent
The instructor was very available and helpful. The TA did a great job of commenting in class and for making time to meet with students.

The TA was perhaps the best TA I've ever had. She went above and beyond what I could have hoped for. It would be helpful if the prof supplemented the class with recommended readings -- papers or articles on how to write and present scientific material.
Great, especially considering the number of students.
Elaine was reasonable available and willing to help

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This is one of the most important courses to my program. I came here to do research, and this course taught me how to formally communicate my findings through oral and written pathways.

I wish that there had been a year long class like this during my first two semesters as well. It would have greatly helped me to develop my research and prepare for the summer field season instead of leaving me feeling like I was in completely over my head. Natural Science Research Methods filled this gap somewhat but I feel it could be expanded to help the new MESc students.
This course helped provide a class structure for working on my thesis. I thought it was useful to work with other students.
Helps put together the final research deliverable.
Perfect. This should be a required course.
This class more than any other has prepared me for conferences and for understanding how I should go about explain and presenting my work.
As a MFS degree working with Mark Ashton, this course was essential to my interests.
It really helped me develop my thesis, it was crucial in keeping me on track (schedule-wise), and all the practice in presenting was very very helpful when it came time to present at the Colloquium.
I don't plan to be an academic or publish too many papers, but now I'm familiar with the process and will hopefully get one paper published!

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To guide my thesis writing.
As a capstone for my MEM and guidance for my thesis work.
To support me as I worked on my master's project.
For the feedback from my classmates and the professor.
Because I needed guidance to complete my master's thesis.
It is great for writing your research thesis.
I felt I would get a lot out of guidance and input from my peers, practice presenting, and oontinuous guidance from the instructor on research methods and publication readiness.
To get the practice of communicating scientific material, and to help develop my own thesis.
To help move me forward on my thesis and receive additional feedback.
To learn more about the paper-writing process and get more field experience simultaneously

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes.
Far exceeded my expectations.
Exceeded expectations
YES! And more.
Yes.
Yes.
yes!
Completely.
Yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes.
Far more - see "best things about this course", above.
Yes
Yes!
Yes.
Yes.
yes
Yes, I got a great amount of help from the professor, TA and fellow students.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was very helpful to have peer groups review written papers.
It was good to have other people read my work and give me feedback. It was hard that they were not in my field of study, so sometimes it was not productive feedback.
Small peer-review editing groups - worked out great - very valuable.
Peer review was helpful, though I don't think that all groups met.
Having peer evaluations was very helpful. I saw no disadvantages.
Yes it was helpful to work with the group to edit my paper.
It was really great to have a small group for feedback who knew my subject area.
We were all a bit too busy to really make this as useful as Mark had intended it to be

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it, make full use of the chance to bounce ideas off people and gain confidence!
Take this with Professor Ashton if your interest overlaps with his. Try and work with a professor with similar interests as yours if you are working on a master's thesis.
Just take it. It helps.
This course is amazing.

I have been telling every MESc they should be taking this course. The administration should strongly consider adding something like this course as a standard part of the curriculum. While Mark's feedback is tremendously valuable, it could even potentially be taught by a team of experienced PhD students or postdocs.
If you want to publish, take the course
